revised_title: Vascular Smooth Muscle and Endothelium-Derived Relaxing Factor Interactions
tldr: The authors discovered that vascular smooth muscle cells can synthesize vasoactive substances that interact with endothelium to stimulate the production of endothelium-derived relaxing factor (EDRF), which is now thought to be nitric oxide. This finding challenges the traditional belief that endothelium is the primary source of EDRF and suggests a new role for vascular smooth muscle in regulating blood vessel tone.
